document_data.name: Saladrex
document_data.refs2e: <ref group="note">In the original ''[[Baldur's Gate II: Throne of Bhaal]]'' Saladrex' alignment was [[chaotic evil]]. This was changed in the [[Baldur's Gate II: Enhanced Edition|Enhanced Edition]].
document_data.mainbody: '''Saladrex''' was an especially vain and prideful [[red dragon]].
document_data.Description: He was old enough that he considered a few years to be a minuscule amount of time.
document_data.Personality:
Saladrex viewed himself in the most grandiose terms. He enjoyed being referred to by various honorifics and was not above responding well to flattery.

He would refer to humanoid [[adventurer]]s as "puny".
document_data.Possessions: He had a particularly desirable hoard, which was sought after by many adventurers. Among his treasures was the ''[[Staff of the Ram]]'', a unique ''[[staff of striking]]''.
document_data.History:
Some time during the 1360s [[DR]], Saladrex made his lair within the 4{{th}} level of the [[Watcher's Keep]]. He was summoned to the keep by the "Lord of the Level" [[Carston]], by means of the [[Machine of Lum the Mad]].

Saladrex remained within the keep because of the amusement he found in Carston's antics. He was particularly delighted by the endless battle fought by the [[githyanki]] and [[illithid]]s who each had encampments nearby.
